resources.string: Interrupt2k19
Map
Interrupt 2019 is a National Level Technical Symposium conducted by Computer Science Department of Sri Venkateswara College of Engineering.

Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum has been the industry\'s standard dummy text ever since the 1500s, when an unknown printer took a galley of type and scrambled it to make a type specimen book.

This is where your ideas come to life. 
 Interrupt'19 is proud to present you Presentation Nation, a platform where you get to showcase your innovative skills and research. Pen down your most creative ideas, submit a paper and give an intriguing presentation on it. Impress, inspire and you'll stand a chance to grab the prize! 


Topics: 
 •Internet of things 
 •Cloud Security and privacy 
 •Virtualization 
 •HPC on Cloud 
 •Honeypot 
 •Wireless communication System 
 •Bluetooth Technology 
 •Data Management and Sensor Networks 
 •Speech signal Analysis by signal processing 
 •Data Security using Neural Networks 
 •Big Data analytics 
 •MapReduce 
 •Big Data search and mining 
 •Big Data security and privacy

•Team of 3 
 •The presentation time for each team will be 15 minutes.
 •Judgement criteria will be based on presentation, innnovation and technicality involved in the project.
 •The papers should be in IEEE format.
 •Participants should bring their paper in PDF or Word format in pendrive.
 •Jury's decision is final.
Ajay Saba - 9488821895

Poster coaster,a poster presentation event which aids the participants to rattle their brains and untie their ideas.Here is the chance to bring out the power of the days you spent pondering over mind boggling ideas.So unveil your innovative minds and be one among many to show the talent you posses.

•Team of 2.
 •Presentation time for each team is 10 minutes.
 •The judgement criteria will be based on originality, creativity and clarity.
 •Participants should bring the poster in pdf/jpg/png format in pendrive.
 •Jury's decision will be final.
Sumneeth – 9786691724

Are you an intellect ready for sparring with your opponent at a game of words? Here\'s the perfect opportunity to bring out the orator in you!Talk your way through and impress the panel with your technical and oratory skills!Hurry up and register to showcase your technical +rhetorical skills for the world to see!\n The topics for the event will be given on the spot.

•Individual participation only.
 •Time limit should not be exceeded.
 •Decorum should be maintained.
 •Judgement criteria will be based on presentation, technical points and coherence.
 •Jury\’s decision will be final.

For those who love front-end, here is a chance to showcase your talent. We bring you, the Game of \u003c tags \u003e. Parade your web design skills at this fun event! Design the most attractive website using UX/UI and make even Charlotte envy your web!

•Team of either 1 or 2 members.
 •The event will be conducted for 6 consecutive hours on the day of the symposium.
 •Participants must bring their own laptops.
 •Website or webpage should be designed on the common theme announced on the spot.
 •Entries must be submitted within the given time limit.
 •The participants with the highest number of votes will be announced the winners on Interrupt'19
Yuvaraj J - 8946083003\nShriram SG - 9952070437

Love mysteries and solving puzzles? Do you also love coding? Look no further. Awaken your inner Sherlock and demystify erred codes. Debug programs and assemble jumbled up codes to earn pieces of a puzzle which will ultimately reveal the bigger picture!

•Team of two.
 •Internet and workstation will be provided.
 •Programming language used is C++.
 •Total score of each participant will be the cumulated points from all rounds.
 •In case of a tie, team which completed the rounds earlier will be announced the winner.
Jyotsna - 9566964383\nAdarshya -7092738888

Can you code efficiently? Is your code optimal? Test your skills here! Code your way through this online event by buying keywords. But beware! Spend your points wisely. Ready to code? Then head over to Stack Market!Stack market is an offline problem solving event. But with a twist! Play a fun game and earn cash. In the next round, buy keywords for your program using the cash earned. The person with the highest cash remaining wins.

•Team of two.
 •Internet and workstation will be provided.
 •Internet surfing is not allowed.
 •Programming language used is C++.
 •Total score of each participant will be the cumulated points from all rounds.
 •In case of a tie, team which completed the rounds earlier will be announced the winner.
Sujith - 6380592928\nSree Vishal - 7358499668

Were you waiting for the full on nail biting coding event as always? Well it\'s here and now you can put your hard acquired expertise in coding to action. Interrupt19\'s Code connoisseur is an online mainstream coding event where you can code to your heart\'s content and go from one level to the next. Think and wrack your brains for this one!

•Individual participation only.
 •Participation will be live online.
 •Points will be awarded for each level cleared.
 •Total score of each participant will be the cumulated points from all rounds.
 •In case of a tie, participant who completed the rounds earlier will be announced the winner on Interrupt'19.

Here\'s something fun yet challenging for all the cool nerds out there. Our trademark event Interrupt challenge 2.0 is what you need to look out for! Find the hidden clue in each level to progress to the next. It\'s engaging, it\’s fun and it\'ll help unleash the inner genius in you!

•Individual participation only.
 •Participation will be live online.
 •Participants cannot register more than once.
 •Originality of username at registration is appreciated.
 •In case of a tie, participant who completes earlier will be announced the winner on Interrupt'19.

Modern problems require modern solutions. Alt+Tab+Tech is an event for all the quick-witted innovators out there! Think on your feet and switch between technologies and ideas to provide solutions to brain-wracking problems. In the first round, test your team\'s connectivity through a fun game and win a trump card that will influence your performance in the second round. Go on to provide solutions to the problem statements based on the domains you get in round robin basis.

•Team of 2
 •Solutions maybe pictorial or abstract or algorithm
 •Judgement criteria is based on presentation, innovation and technicality involved in the solution.
 •Jury's decision is final.
Barath - 9884630716\nSeshai Hari - 6382118062
